name: cheapcynicism
text:
I don't know if the ease with which Philippe is delighted is endearing or depressing.

Still love the kid, though.

name: billylk
text: Endearing I'd say. The only way it could become depressing is if you're mourning your own dead child as you watch someone else's very alive child become delighted.

name: waldo913
text: Lie Bot? Is that you?

name: rainwolfj
text: Lie bot lies, yet his words ring true.

name: lexsenthur
text: Tite...tite...

name: shutup_shutup
text: A  comment/avatar combo.

name: thesoulbear
text: The person who lamed this has had this exact thing happen to him.

name: doctorbeene
text:
The gift is similar to T forgiving Lyle for Christmas.

It's complex, and it's just what they would want as a gift...but it's free as the dickens.

name: yamo
text: Todd will always be my favorite. Followed by Lyle. You just don't grow up in California without meeting at least one Todd and/or Lyle.

name: jthompson
text: Sadly, you don't even grow up in Wisconsin without knowing at least one Todd and/or Lyle.

name: miku224
text: Hey, another Wisconsinite!  It sucks here, doesn't it?

name: jthompson
text: A comment left by jthompson was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dainbramage, dr_sexlove, turkfish)

name: jack_samson
text: True story, my friends on the far north side of Chicago are referred to as Wisconsinites.  It's not a term of endearment.

name: hubajube
text: My old roommate was from Wisconsin and just got a job in Chicago with a bunch of FIBs.  When his coworkers found out where he was from, they got all cold, and one said, "We know what you call us."

name: deovalente
text:
I'm more familiar with the variant "FIP." I get a kick out of my Indiana friends calling people from Chicago FIPs and my Chicago relatives calling Indiana people FIPs.

Michigan ain't much better, though, but at least we've got like fudge and hands for maps and shit.

name: featurelessvoid
text:
I had no idea what FIB meant (never been to Wisconsin, and I know Chicago only as the place where you have to run a marathon to catch your connecting flight on the other side of the airport), but UrbanDictionary just explained it to me. Thank you Interweb!

The Interwebs. Is there anything they can't do?

name: gunsofray
text: they certainly cant bring back a beloved pet cat..

name: kaithekender
text: Or a beloved childhood drum.

name: spicerice
text: A comment left by spicerice was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by skizm699, lamboyster, riotdejaneiro, Triactry03, coffeecoaster, radishes, Mastronaut)

text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mysterymeat1001, prolefeed5, apocowarg, littlecat, riotdejaneiro, orvel, glorify, fosters, LORD_HUMUNGUS, rascaldom, mtrott, 762, prism, coffeecoaster, atticusonline, Jeet, BrianNotBrian, logic, Setzkin, cailetshadow, Epicurus, Chromancer, aperson, UserBeliever)

name: epicurus
text: I'm not even American and this annoys me.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, coffeecoaster, BrianNotBrian, cailetshadow, usversusthem)

name: epicurus
text: No, YOU heavy... down!

name: soticoto
text: My avatar is already the Weighted Companion Cube. Do you expect me to increase its mass yet further?

name: caseyb3
text: Man, hearing your part of the exchange in GLaDOS's voice is too much. Consider yourself Chubbied for no good reason.

name: epicurus
text: That last one is something that GLADOS would say.

name: epicurus
text: Oh shit, damn italics!

name: soticoto
text:
...... *Thinks about it*

Y'know... I can't tell if you're right or not on that. It has GLaDoS's childish streak... but somehow I imagine she'd make it sound better...
Borderline.

name: gitarooman
text: Fuck you soticoto, you suck.

name: soticoto
text:
Only the good things.
Only the good things.

name: onepapertiger
text: No, that's totally fair. America's a pretty new country. Shit reflects in our culture from the schools up and we're still working out all the petty kinks of completely subjective regionalism. When I see a bunch of dudes from Ireland or Wales or England arguing over whose city rules more, I grin and lean closer, waiting for the hilarious arguments only an open minded but tunnel-visioned person can provide, like how a true gentleman spits politely in the presence of a lady (with her permission and only through three or more layers of tissue, a made-up source )

name: soticoto
text: Well, I find it kinda funny when people do that sorta thing here too... but that wasn't what was happening, y'know? Was just americans this time.

name: dondoran
text: I disagree.  Wisconsin has much most beautiful natures.

name: tellumo
text:
I was wondering how long it would take for someone to make an Illinois crack.

<-- grew up in Minneapolis, BS '02 at Madison, now lives in SF

name: raysdangnachos
text:
See, you guys have to lay it down, admit Chicago rules the region, and focus your ire where it belongs.

Towards the coasts.

name: dans
text: Illinois is 95% booze and 5% meth.

name: menthol
text: Man, don't be doin' your fuzzy maths without showing your work.  These are the kind of statistics that keep me awake at night...all with the car trunks exploding.

name: luckyg
text: Reno is more like 50/50.

name: cameasiam
text: I grew up in Concord California. I think it was 100/100.

name: gormster
text:
Listen, objectively, Illinois does have an awesome album written about it. And what's with all the interstate fighting? We don't have that here. We love all our neighbours...

except for the fucking Victorians.

name: ljuke
text:
What sucks is that I went to Melbourne this year and everyone was really nice to me.

Way to screw up my hate for Victoria, Melbournites!

name: farqussus
text: There must have been people from Brisbane in Melbourne that day. Talking to you.

name: libelandslander
text:
Your comment made me start thinking about... well... timetravelers and... cross-period hate.

"ELIZABETHANS ARE TERRIBLE DRIVERS!"
"FUCK THE VICTORIANS!"

name: gitarooman
text: So does Michigan. But they're both pretty boring.

name: leon_sumbitches
text:
just cause you got a beef with chicago, don't mean u got to drag the rest of the state in.

we here in central illinois are only moderately insane.

name: nodal
text: All 3 people in Illinois lamed you.

name: aikennubbles
text: Even California's not that great if you're from Bakersfield (apparently the state's capital of baby-drowning)

name: hellaedgar
text: Los Angeles is a piece of shit, though.

name: ntopp
text: I'm told Indio's no treat either, though it plays host to the dazzling Coachella each year.

name: alejandroadam
text: I live close to Bakersfield. further out into the nothing. and I agree it is not rad.

name: fox
text:
Seeing all you guys argue and complain about where you live in the States makes me really glad I live in Canada.
Not sayin' it's all a bed of roses up here, but at least it isn't **insert State name**

name: senseihollywood
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: andrew_
text: stay tuned for "Mexico - America's Beard"!

name: digdugz
text: I wish I could chubby this comment ten thousand times.

name: gormster
text: America, that hat is way too big for your head.

name: audhumla
text: America is Little Nephew

name: deusoma
text: I prefer the prison analogy that Canada is "bigger, and on top."

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Contrasoma, trollcollins, apocowarg, Cyberbob, wittyname, atticusonline, Epicurus, amadaun, UserBeliever, aparrish)

name: bink
text:
Dude, why do you keep on giving everyone the impression that us Brits are complete jack-offs?

Cut it out!

name: soticoto
text:
... I never said I represented the rest of this country.
I'm just me. I'm not Britain. I'm not Wales nor England either.
I'm not this country, county, city, borough nor postal code. I am just a sack of meat with opinions and no fear of expressing them, no matter what other opinions they may contradict.

name: farqussus
text: you're about as good a companion as a cube can be.

name: deusoma
text: At least he's never threatened to stab me.

name: eileens_wetwipe
text: Seriously!

name: alejandroadam
text: we were all talking about different citys/countys in rural california, but the strip oftain mentions such places. but yes. I totally agree with your post.

name: bixschmix
text: Dude I was born in Bakersfield and go the hell out of there as fast as possible. Bakersfield is Circumstances.

name: thesoulbear
text: Good dickens that is a trance-inducing avatar.

name: brodiebruce
text: I've read 6 years worth of strips so far and the only thing that could make me comment is mutual Wisconsin self loathing.

name: sacrificialgoat
text: Is it bad that I might be the Lyle to many of my friends?

name: jstegall
text: No, just don't be the Todd to your friends. They'll think you suck dick to pay for your transportation needs.

name: senseihollywood
text: of course, if you're the Lyle to your friends that means you are the woman of the band...and accordingly must provide hot stews until your replacement is identified...

name: joestork
text:
you're definitely not the Lyle if you're gonna pussy-assedly ask on the internet if it's bad to be the Lyle.

Sorry to flame, but s'true

name: lauralou
text: Sadly you just don't grow up in England without knowing at least one Lyle- Todds on the other hand are an American thing!

name: pwb
text: hell man, sometimes it feels like all of my friends are Todd and Lyle

name: ih8jonmayr
text: Ray needs some credit, though. He is great to Philippe and always has something planned for his birthday, Christmas, etc. I foresee Ray as a great father some day.

name: nbgreene
text: it's a special day

name: brian
text: Doing a line of coke in someone's face is a going to be the new #1 sign of disrespect in the fourth quarter.

name: zaratustra
text: One-handed snorting should not be attempted by untrained personnel.

name: theoneyouwant
text: and running is right out.

name: evolume
text: it must be the first use of "do cocaine" as a transitive verb in history.

name: phthoggos
text: Sorry, boss. No direct object.

name: evolume
text: Actually (and i'm no english major) but in the sentence, "Don't YOU do cocaine at ME, you son of a bitch," isn't "ME" the direct object?

name: shockofsputnik
text: It's the object of a prepositional phrase. So no.

name: ttagxamm
text: repent, spectre, said the ticktockman.

name: biff
text: But Jeffty was un-fived by an ill-considered remark.  I hope neither Lyle nor Lie Bot does the same thing to poor Philippe.

name: mrclarinet
text: He really should have emphasized that when running for President.  Not just being five, but being five forever.

name: pyromancer
text: When compressed, is it 'damnit' or 'dammit'?  Militant grammarians, into the breach!

name: augeno13
text: dammit is widely considered correct and one of the suggested correct spellings when "damnit" is entered at dictionary.com.  merriam webster only includes dammit in their premium dictionary.  bastards.

name: fox
text: He's a stuffed animal.... they don't age.  They just have birthdays because it's fun.

name: aplomb
text: It's kind of like Onstad is spitting in the face of the real-time aging characters from For Better Or For Worse. And it's magnificent.

name: imitationcrab
text: Consider this:  Maybe this is a flashback strip to when Phillipe first turned 5.

name: kledermans
text: I thought that too, but then I decided that I didn't want it to be.

name: twoply
text: Todd also has the "new Todd" look of present era Achewood. He is presented with the current shorter snout. I said that in my head with a heavily nasal voice..... somewhat like Thurston Howell III.

name: senseihollywood
text:
Achewood Theater Presents:

Giiligan's 5th Birthday Party

Thurston Howell III:
"Lovey... I say... Lovey!...will you Please stop doing that cocaine at Gilligan...it's his Birthday for Pete's sake...besides, that is just so, oh, how do you say, common ...

honestly Lovey, you'd think we were slumming in the Hamptons with those ghastly Hilton sisters...again...mwah ha...mwah haha...haha...

I say, Lovey... that's not our Tiffany mirror, is it?"

name: zefiel
text: it's a Gustavian Demi-Lune.

name: talix18
text: Now do it with Roombas!

name: spectre
text: But there is a companion birthday blog entry for Phillipe, making it clear this is the present day.

name: imitationcrab
text:
Ah.. but the blog doesn't mention this incident with Ray and Todd or how old he is this year. The only info we get is that August 22nd is his birthday.

(It's funny that his birthday would have been August 23rd if they hadn't accidently posted Friday's strip on Thursday.)

name: gormster
text: Actually, tomorrow's strip references something directly in the blog (the meat chart).

name: ryabovsky
text:
Philippe: the only candidate in the 2008 election who won't have to change his slogan from 2004.

An eternal five year old? He's got my vote.

name: wae
text: the Mr. Poopytime camp has benefited greatly from a groundswell of grassroots support.

name: alejandroadam
text: I felt a fun ironic sense of sarcasm in this comment. I enjoyed it, I say calm down lamers. chubby this up.

name: connellingus
text: Good god, this is the first strip in a long time that's made me laugh out loud.

name: riazm
text: Where's Ray's fucking bow tie? This is a special day, what the fuck? Where's the bow tie, Ray? Obscured by your chin?

name: jthompson
text: Ray gave his bowtie to Phillipe when Phillipe realized he had forgotten his. The present presentation would not have gone so smoothly if Phillipe had already been crying.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that is exactly what happened.

name: tellumo
text: I thought he had some kind of collarless European thing going on.

name: 1000hz

Philippe can never be Not Five.

Neither can the rating of this strip.

My feelings exactly.

This became one of favorites at the sixth frame: "Don't you do cocaine at ME, you son of a bitch!"

I also love the variety of sniffing onomatopoeia.

Note the kneeling position, and the gentle, graceful curve in panel six as Todd snorts yet more cocaine.
The dude has no mercy.

Cocaine ideas

Does it make you a genius

Old school Achewood. I've missed you so... :D

name: happycat
text:
Would it be okay if I offered to do this at parties? I can't really think of a better job than being hired to go to some kids birthday and do drugs then laugh it off.

"Hey, Jimmy! It was all a joke! Now hand me some cake and block the wind so I can light this."

name: songbirdspectre
text: philippe has fastened his bowtie under his arms.

name: lateadopter
text:
For next year's Very Special Episode, Lyle will not get drunk and do potty on Philippe's book about Cunty, punch Philippe in the stomach, or even tell him to shove it. The first item is really self-serving, as that book is now Lyle's main source of income, but the other two are genuinely nice gestures.

Cornelius, on the other hand, will still scold Philippe inappropriately.

text: This one is very good. Fuck.

holy shit, first time i've literally laughed out loud.

name: straw
text: Well, to speak the other side (not that I necessarily represent this side, I'm being objective here), you are saying it's not good enough because it has reverted back to a style we all loved when we first came across it. That's valid but really nitpicky. The other nitpicky point-of-view is that this comic never does that SOOO WACKY joke any longer. So how can one win? You can't both be right. But you can probably both be wrong. (note, the SO WAAAACKYYYYY comic got a 4.7 so)

name: fineoakstructure

text:
You know what? I still think I'm right here.

Fuck you all.

Especially you, straw, you crybaby piece of shit. I'm so sorry my outrageous comment completely ruined this strip for you. I hope you've recovered.

If not, may I leave flowers?

Apparently touched a nerve with a few people here, but I'm sure these are the same folks who believe Oswald acted alone.

Think, people: There are TWO squirrels. Todd in the present, some other guy in the closet.

name: madnes
text: No, are you?

name: madnes
text:
*swims around bowl once*

No, are you?

text: Well, all of phillipe's past presents have been disappointments because he expected so much more than what he got. So by setting him up to expect something horrible, getting it taken away made it the best present ever

Oh man, this comic is five today.

This is the best strip.

then I read this strip.

name: geysershitdick
text:
The two highest rated strips revolve around people doing drugs at parties.

Just an observation.

PS: This strip is very excellent.

name: happycat
text: Part of the draw of achewood is that most of the readers relate with the characters so strongly. I drink a lot, do a few drugs, yet still remain literate and urbane. (Or so I would like to think) I think it says something about the readership that Onstad has drawn to the site, which really, is a bunch of people I'd like to hang out with.

name: duskbringer
text: I love you, man.

name: le_chien_manquee
text: but unlike the achewood inhabitants, i always end up in the kitchen at parties.  i only use the bathroom for puking.

name: solobuttons
text: If I could give the STRIP a chubby, I would. This is class.

name: straw
text: Easily, easily the best in weeks.

name: jenlyn423
text: ah, that was awesome.

name: eurakarte
text: What a great strip. It also made me consider how economical it must be to be Todd. Guy can probably get higher than God on 50 cents worth of cocaine, if you think about his size.

name: agentj
text: Ray's running knee and arm just out-of-panel are Old School. And the snort-motion sf/x are pure post-class. Would Onstad frame just a panel?

name: raysdangnachos
text: As good as Achewood has been lately, and it's been really damn good...this is the best strip in ages.

name: epicurus
text:
As I was scrolling by this page I misread the above comment as "as good as achewood has been lately, this one is just unicorn good... this is the best strip in ages.

I thought you'd want to know, internet.

name: charchar
text: Unicorn is officially my New Favourite Adjective. Thank you.

name: catachresis
text: I wish I had a more witty and erudite way of saying how excellent this strip is than the previous posters, but I don't. It's just fucking excellent.

name: astro_zombie
text: Ray and Todd know that, when forgotting to buy a child a birthday gift, an elaborate drug hoax can be just as good if not better.

name: pogogogo
text:
How brilliant is this strip?
Let me count the ways -
Don't you do cocaine at ME...
Sniff, Snaff, Snoof...
Phillipes bithday outfit, including bowtie under the arms.
Sheer magic

name: le_chien_manquee
text: i love todd's rock n roll point as he does the cocaine at ray.  i'm gonna try that the next my wife moans at me for pouring another drink.  or making another line.

name: balvo
text:
Damn, man! Todd totally doesn't care that he has a terrible cocaine addiction at Philippe's birthday party! Rock on, Todd!

Great strip.

name: kingsleymc
text:
Some of Ray's best lines ever. EVER.

Even so, Phillipe wins the cake. "...all those cocaines."

Top shelf. I give it a 5, yo.

name: apatfan
text: I can't believe it took 127 comments to point this out! "all those cocaines" totally made the strip for me

name: asumoactingbig
text: It's my birthday today too!  This strip is all I could want as I turn uh, somewhat older than 5

name: le_chien_manquee
text: happy birthday, sumo man

name: unaware
text: In addition to being an exciting and spirit gift, Ray and Todd also gave their version of an anti-drug commercial to Phillipe.

name: gsurge
text: I seriously died when I read this. It is so good, that this will be my first and only comment.

name: taiiga
text: A comment left by taiiga was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, straw, apocowarg, silver_lake, ppccd, wae, tttt2, equinn2006, catgrl131, megstud, Audhumla, biff, Nictusempra)

name: zefiel
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: taiiga
text: A comment left by taiiga was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, ppccd, habnabit)

name: gyllstromk
text: One of the most hilarious recent Achewoods.

name: tim_simmons
text: urg. i had a todd night last night. a todd night is when you get lit up on the sauce and help your friend engage in crime, go bowling, do some ship lifting, get in a fight, fall over, have an argument with a guy from africa, dance with the same guy, get scars from ... somewhere and wake up the next day ready to do it again!

name: tim_simmons
text: shop. shop lifting.

name: katsura
text: I dunno, ship lifting seems like it could be pretty badass.

name: howard
text: Just straight up lifting a fucking ship.

name: odei
text: Ray has millions of dollars and this is what he sets up for Philippe's birthday?

name: pr0ncess
text:
Philippe looks like a giant droopy pencil in frame 8.

Todd looks like he has a little bank note or something in the second frame, but he obviously decided to dispense with it thereafter.

name: dustyjapanese
text: dag man, this is kind of old school of chris.  I think its mad funny.  don't you do cocaine at me is already catching with my mates.

name: tttt2
text:
oh my this is fantastic

this is my favorite strip without a doubt

name: mikeleffel2
text: We don't pretend to run around at my place anymore. It would be a special birthday indeed! :)

name: mrclarinet
text:
God damn I love panel seven.

Awesome composition.

name: ctrl-s
text: Don't say cocaine ideas.

name: irreverend
text: HAHAHAHA SO GOOD!! "All those cocaines" bahahaha there's so much good material in here!

name: deancain29
text: This is one of the best Achewood's ever.

name: ctrl-s
text:
Sometimes it takes a while before I fully appreciate a particular strip. But Ray, all fierce -- "Phiippe is FIVE today! That is SPECIAL!" -- fist and shoe raised in pursuit, as Todd continues to snort while fleeing ... definitely 5.

"That is SPECIAL!"

name: wae
text: so good.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: Sniff is the sound it makes when he is regular-snorting. SNFFFFFFZZ is the sound it makes when his nose is in contact with whatever the cocaine happens to be laid on. You can also notice that Todd was power-snorting in the second strip, as the cocaine is flying to his nose from at least one inch away.

name: anitrophaeron
text: Panel 6 is my favorite single Achewood panel ever.  There's a ton of close seconds, but that one is king.

name: afronaut
text: Ray has an EXCELLENT knee in the 7th panel.

name: molesticide
text: this is basically the best strip i've seen in a very long time.

name: hendetta
text: Easy to find, being the only strip containing the word "snaff".

name: saint
text: WOW. Add not doing cocaine as a top-ranking last-minute gift idea! Don't have time to do shopping? No problem! Run around sniffing salt for a few panels, then pop out of a box and yell "SURPRISE! I'M NOT HIGH!"

name: gormster
text: Someone has never had salt up their nose.

name: zefiel
text: Then that'd be gift enough?

name: psychology
text: so...in my short time reading Achewood, I've run into your name in the comments a lot. you do NOT make me laugh, nor do you contribute ANYTHING to the comments. please stop breathing.

name: spicyponyhead
text: Oh man, you're totally being a cock to a stranger.

name: saint
text: I'd say his avatar accuarately represents him.

name: denise
text: rays legs in panel 6 make me feel wierd. they look creepy.

name: mr2tyler
text: The best part about this is the backward F in the first panel.

name: anitrophaeron
text: backward what now???

name: monkalie
text: this might be my all time favorite

name: cousinted
text:
[IMGS OFF]
I'm Doctor Rockso; the Rock'n'Roll Clown
I DO COCAINE!

I hear it's somebody's birthday
I DO COCAINE!

Doctor Rockso gonna make you a BALLOON BASS!

seriously dude, a lot of cocaine.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i am of the opinion that Murderface was never Five.

name: achilleselbow
text: You're wrong, in that episode when they all met their parents they showed baby Murderface watching his dad kill his mom with a chainsaw and then kill himself. That may be the saddest thing.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: yeah, that's what i mean! he zipped right from being Two to...however old he is now.

name: drskradley
text: Philippe's present is that Todd was not really snorting cocaine.

name: killingthejay
text: 1000 squirels on 1000 grams of cocaine on 1000 typewriters will eventually produce an exact transcript of Kerouac's "On The Road."

name: nikopol
text: Todd sounds like Blackalicious, here.

name: i_love_kate
text: Let's work hard to bring this up to a 4.9, folks!

name: i_love_kate
text: Shut the hell up, dick.

name: theguitarhero
text: you suck!

name: theguitarhero
text: no, YOU DO.

name: takepills
text: god, every time i read this i laugh more

name: tbtabby
text: How can you not laugh at Todd's spiteful coke-sniffing in panel 6?

name: imbeta
text: Not only is Phillipe turning 5 (yet again) but he also looks like a Rocket. An Otter Rocket.

name: farqussus
text: I must be a main mattering man, because the slow-down before the speed up added to the art of this artifice. To me.

name: qingofchina
text: Achewood's rendition of a Guy Ritchie film.

name: soticoto
text:
Philippe asks Liebot once again: "What is the saddest thing?"

Liebot is silent for some moments... not even asking the question any more... before he starts.

"Ray is going to enter the room half an hour from now, quite drunk, and shall ask you: What do you want to be when you grow up? But you are never going to grow up, so you shall become very upset.
Ray will then take you out to the theme park in order to cheer you up, and only then will you find out that you are too short to go on any of the rides. Forever."

name: thecasbah
text:
"all those cocaines" in the eighth panel is the reason I read Achewood now.
Viva la Philippe.

name: tucky
text: This was the first achewood strip I ever read.  That is why I'm here.

name: hardelicious
text: I want this for a birthday present someday.

name: hardelicious
text: I also like the idea of doing cocaine at someone.

name: achilleselbow
text: This is the strip where my trawl through the archives ended, as I reconnected with the spot where I had originally started reading. I feel that I deserve a prize of some sort.

name: biznart
text:
"How dare you have a terrible cocaine addiction at Philippe's birthday party!"

I thought the strip couldn't get any better after that. I was wrong.

name: giantants
text: Panel 4 is a self-contained theoretical treatise on comic timing, camouflaged as a cocaine idea.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: I had a birthday!

name: i_love_kate
text:
"Then we had cake and we almost had ice cream but Téodor forgot to put his ice cream mixer part in the freezer over night so we pretended to run around in the back yard. Guess what! I won!"

I thought even the non blog-readers should be treated to this.

name: ediblestars
text: WAIT HERE WHILST I TAKE SOME COCAINES

name: paby
text: Phillipe is just a tube so the bowtie has to go under his armpits.

name: mrectomy
text: "Don't you do cocaine at ME, you son of a bitch!" makes this one a 5/5.

name: inthetunk
text: I swore off of the stuff, but this strip is so good it makes me want to pick some up just to be able to say this.

name: singtralala
text: whoa, what a great present! i can't wait till next mother's day to get one of these for my mum

name: cheesesandwich
text: Story of my life.

name: kikineko
text: Aw, happy day indeed.  Philippe is very lucky to look forward to his birthday every year... If only we can.

name: changuitotuerto
text: Stuttering only makes alliteration that much more beautiful. Cocaine doesn't hurt, either.

name: generalfunk
text: Doing cocaine AT someone is one of the most vindicating gestures one can make to another person without being overtly aggressive.

name: arelladawn
text: I like how Philippe's bowtie is like going under his arms and around the top of his chest since he lacks a neck of any sort

name: daaaaang
text: Ray cold dons a tux for Philippes birthday party

name: puguglypress
text: In panel 7, Ray is running like a fucking Looney Tune or some shit.

name: nyl
text: Who wants to bet that Todd actually was doing cocaine?

name: jonmw
text:
I went looking for this strip, now I have found and saved it.

That is all.

name: wrmeade
text:
He's five... today?
What?

name: tonyhighwind
text:
It's probably been said, but still...
Classic Todd.

name: theirateturk
text: This is easily the greatest

name: panamajack
text: How does Onstad come up with a billion great comic ideas? It's not even a weekly webcomic! It's almost every day! I mean, almost every strip has something quotable, there are almost too much catchy phrases. and it takes a great amount of human truth and agility of language to create a catchy phrase. And Onstad does it EVERY DAY. Wha... how?

name: panamajack
text: Too many, not too much. You grammarded son of a bitch.

name: tollschaft
text: Best present ever.

name: rulesboy
text: I guess I know what I'm getting Michael Irvin this year!

name: masterbbb26
text: wow i wonder how much Ray had to pay Todd to not do cocaine for 5 minutes

name: lungfish
text: Eventually it will be revealed that Philippe is an android or something, explaining why he's been five years old for so many years.

name: lawnfire
text: I always come to read this strip on my birthday now. Which is today. That is special. I'm so happy Todd didn't do all those cocaines.
